cs2410.assn4.model

Class ImageList

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs2410.assn4.model.ImageList

  • public class ImageList
extends java.lang.Object
    ImageList contains an array list of ImageData objects and methods to add, remove, and get info from ImageData objects. Contains methods to read and write .txt files that contain ImageData info - and image's URL and Title. Tracks the content of the imageList and puts a "No Image Found" ImageData object in the array list if the user has not added any images of their own. Removes the "No Image Found" ImageData when a new image is added.
    Author:
    Steven Proctor

    • Field Detail

      • imageList

        private java.util.ArrayList<ImageData> imageList
        Private array list of ImageData Objects

      • noImage

        private static final ImageData noImage
        Private ImageData object that contains a "No Image Found" object. Stored in imageList when imageList is empty.

      • noImageFound

        private boolean noImageFound
        Private boolean the contains true when there are no images in the imageList

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageList

        public ImageList(java.lang.String fileName)
        Public Constructor that initializes the array list.

    • Method Detail

      • addImage

        public void addImage(java.lang.String url,
                     java.lang.String title,
                     int index)
        Creates a new ImageData object using given parameters and stores the new object in imageList If adding a new image to an empty imageList, removes the "No Image Found" object and resets noImageFound to false.
        Parameters:
        url - String containing the images' URL
        title - String containing the image's Title
        index - integer for the index at which the new image will be added to the imageList

      • removeImage

        public void removeImage(int element)
        Removes a imageData object from imageList based on a given index. If removing the last image in imageList, adds the "No Image Found" object and sets noImageFound to true.
        Parameters:
        element - an int for the index of the element to be removed

      • getImageURL

        public java.lang.String getImageURL(int element)
        Getter method that returns the URL of an image, given an index for the element in imageList
        Parameters:
        element - an int for the index of the image in question
        Returns:
        the url string for the image

      • getImageTitle

        public java.lang.String getImageTitle(int element)
        Getter method that returns the title of an image, given an index for the element in imageList
        Parameters:
        element - an int for the index of the image in question
        Returns:
        the title string for the image

      • getImage

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage(int element)
        Getter method that returns the image contained in imageData, given an index for the element in imageList
        Parameters:
        element - an int for the index of the image in question
        Returns:
        the image object contained in imageData

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Getter method that returns the current size of the imageList
        Returns:
        size of imageList

      • noImageFound

        public boolean noImageFound()
        Getter method that returns false if imageList contains images, and true if it contains no images
        Returns:
        noImageFound

      • readFile

        private void readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reads data from a .txt file containing an image's URL and Title, creates a new ImageData object using the data, and stores the new object in imageList. Sets noImageFound to true if no images were obtained from the file
        Parameters:
        fileName - the path and filename for the .txt file that the data will be read from.

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Writes the contents of imageList to a .txt file. Specifically the URL and title of each ImageData object.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the path and filename for the .txt file that the data will be written to.
